check, online transactions, gift and loyalty cards, cash advances and the revolutionary EPS90. Our patented in-house payment plan of up to $5000 over 90-days with no credit check required facilitating traders to enhance their client base and revenues.

Here are few things to be considered about online payment systems.ACH payments are electronic credit and debit transfers which allow users to pay directly from their bank accounts for different types of bills such as utilities, mortgage loans etc. ACH stands for Automated Clearing House and the majority of payment processors put forward ACH payment options to their customers, particularly for monthly- and subscription-based transactions. Most payment solutions use ACH to send money (minus fees) to their customers.
A merchant account is a bank account that permits a customer to accept payments by means of credit or debit cards. Merchant providers are required to follow rules established by card associations. Many processors (such as the ones listed below) act as both the merchant account as well as the payment gateway. A payment gateway permits merchants to safely pass credit card information among the customer and the merchant and also between merchant and the payment processor.
The payment gateway acts as the middleman between the merchant and their supporting bank. A payment processor is the company that a merchant make use to handle credit card dealings. Payment processors apply anti-fraud procedures to make sure that both the front-facing customer and the merchant are cosseted.
PCI compliance is when a merchant or payment gateway sets their payment situation up in a way that rallies the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS). The PCI DSS standard was formed by the Payment Card Industry Security Standards Council to raise security of cardholder data and to diminish fraud.

outstanding online payment systems service

There are large numbers of online payment systems available in the market that can be used to conduct e-commerce activities such as online payment system and electronic payment system. Following are the 10 outstanding online payment systems.

1. Authorize.Net
Authorize.Net is the Internet’s most extensively used payment gateway which have the user base of more than 300,000 merchants, Authorize.Net has been the go-to method for e-commerce sites that require a gateway to receive payments. Commonly used e-commerce podiums such as Magento, Volusion and X-Cart are designed to receive payments using Authorize.Net easier.

2.PayPal
PayPal is the world’s most broadly used payment acquirer which has processed over $4 billion in payments in 2011. PayPal payments are made either by using a user’s existing account or with a credit card. PayPal help to send money directly to an email address, as a tool to promote users to sign up for a new PayPal account. Moreover to taking payments, PayPal also permits its users to send money through the service and this feature is only provided by few payment solution providers.
3. Google Checkout
Google Checkout is Google’s respond to PayPal. Google Checkout allows users to pay for goods and services by making use of an account which is connected to their Google profile. The major advantage that Google Checkout has over the opposition is that millions of Internet users use Google for other services, which makes it easier to purchase through Google Checkout.

4. Amazon Payments
Amazon Payments offers its users to accept money using its API (and to send money out via ACH). Popular crowd funding site Kickstarter uses Amazon Payments.

5. Dwolla
Dwolla is a direct opponent to PayPal. One of the recently introduced systems in the third-party payments space, the company is dealing in more than $1 million per day. Setting up Dwolla payments is parallel to PayPal, although Dwolla doesn’t have the same name respect as their competitor.

6. Stripe
Stripe provides an exceptional payment solution for web developers who would be interested to integrate a payment system into their developments using Stripe’s robust API. By avoiding the traditional sign up process, Stripe acts as a merchant account for its providers, handling all PCI compliance and merchant approvals.

7. Braintree
Braintree is an online payment gateway and merchant account solution which is acknowledged for working with famous tech startups such as Airbnb and Living Social.

8. Samurai by FeeFighters
Samurai is a payment gateway and merchant account solution. The company’s key product, FeeFighters, is a tool to assist merchants evaluating rates for merchant accounts. Samurai was developed as a direct opponent to Braintree and other gateway/merchant solutions and provide its customers with a payment gateway or a gateway/merchant account package.

9. WePay
WePay is a payment processor that permits Internet merchants to receive credit cards and bank account payments online. WePay gives the impression to be centered on the individual user, and has newly added e-store pages to their service to assist their customers expediently take in payments (e.g. event tickets, products, donations and so forth) by means of their service.
10. 2Checkout
2Checkout is a new payment processor that merges a merchant account and payment gateway into one, letting customers to obtain credit card payments as well as PayPal payments. The company offers international payments, shopping cart stores as well as a recurring billing facet.

Conclusion
There are large numbers of online payment systems available in the market that can be used to conduct e-commerce activities. Choose one that’s in line with your business objectives. This isn’t an extensive list of online payment systems. If your favorite online payment system isn’t on the list, please share it with us in the comments and discuss why you give it preference over other online payment systems.
